pages.text:
Our Mission and Vision
Naples Art Institute is a place to discover, learn about, and engage with the art of our time. As a cornerstone of Naples’ cultural landscape, we welcome artists, students, and visitors to explore the powerful connection between observing and creating art. Our mission is to serve as a catalyst for a more connected, creative, and informed community.
Our Story
Mission
View fullsize
At the heart of our work lies a dedication to sparking curiosity, fostering meaningful connections, and promoting learning and growth within our community. Our mission is to enlighten, engage, educate, and enrich the community, building on Naples Art Institute’s history and position of leadership as a hub of visual contemporary art with a local and global footprint.
Vision
At our core, we hold the belief that art has the power to positively impact both individuals and communities. Our aim is to provide a platform for a variety of perspectives and voices, with the hope of using our cultural influence to promote inclusive and contemporary ideas, foster meaningful dialogue, and showcase art that reflects the present day. Through these efforts, we strive to contribute to the advancement of a more united and cohesive community.

Our Team
Frank Verpoorten
Executive Director & Chief Curator
Frank has 20+ years of experience with cultural institutions and museums in Brussels, Belgium, New York City, and Southwest Florida. As an art historian trained in 19th-century European academic art and knowledgeable in Pan-American modern and contemporary art, he has curated and organized more than 100 exhibitions, most notably
Surrealism in Belgium: The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie (2014), The Duchamp Family of Artists (2014), and Museum to Scale 1/7 (2015).
Originally from Brussels, Verpoorten moved to New York City in 2000, where he held curatorial and directorial roles at the Dahesh Museum of Art, Snug Harbor Cultural Center, the Newhouse Center for Contemporary Art, and the Museum of Modern Art. From 2009 to 2012 he was Cultural Attaché for the Delegation of Flanders (Belgium) to the U.S.A. in New York.
Before joining Naples Art Institute, he was Director and Chief Curator of Artis—Naples, The Baker Museum for seven years, earning the appreciation, support, and friendship of the Southwest Florida community through unique, world-class exhibitions, tireless advocacy for the permanent collection, and judicious acquisitions.
He propelled the institution to a new level of excellence and substantially grew and advanced the appreciation of the museum’s collections. He expanded the collection by securing major acquisitions from the late Olga Hirshhorn and from Charlotte and Paul Corddry. His research on The Baker Museum’s collection culminated with the publication of their first permanent collection book.
In 2019, Verpoorten secured a long-term loan of six iconic paintings by the Belgian surrealist René Magritte from a private collection. The addition of these outstanding works with remarkable provenance substantially raised the museum’s profile nationally and internationally.
Mr. Verpoorten attended the Vrije Universiteit Brussels, Belgium, earning dual master’s degrees in art history and cultural studies.
frank.verpoorten@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Jack Decloedt
Senior Director of Operations
Bringing his experience in managing several businesses to Naples Art Institute, Jack strives for operational excellence and financial stability in support of the Institute’s plan to become Naples’ cultural and educational focal point for the visual arts.
Originally from Belgium, Jack started and ran the European office for an American systems engineering and manufacturing company, then transferred to its headquarters in Colorado, eventually becoming CEO. He later decided to move to Naples, where he co-founded and developed a high-end electronic systems integration firm that raised the bar for customer experience. Upon selling that company, he took on the position of VP and General Manager of a local sign manufacturer, helping to establish it as Southwest Florida’s largest.
Jack’s passion for education, culture and arts is shown in his extensive volunteer work with a Florida university, assisting with the development and installation of numerous art exhibitions as well as the design and implementation of a newly-built museum.
jack.decloedt@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 115
Jenn Doherty
Director of Marketing & Communications
Jenn is a seasoned marketing and communications professional with a Master's degree in Clinical Psychology from Pepperdine University. After 13 years in Los Angeles, where she directed a Hollywood film festival and founded a digital marketing agency with clients such as Rob Lowe, Jenn joined Naples Art Institute as Director of Marketing and Communications. She brings substantial experience in managing campaigns across non-profit and consumer sectors.
jenn.doherty@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 105
Sue Brown Gordon
Art Fair Director
outdoorshows@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 103
Lynn Borzumato
Education Manager
Lynn Borzumato plans and schedules the educational programs each season and manages the daily studio operations for classes, in addition to overseeing program administration for both students and instructors. Lynn came to Naples from Los Angeles, where she spent more than 20 years in project and asset management in the entertainment business.
lynn.borzumato@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 110
Rosanna Coscia
Office Manager & Executive Administrative Assistant
Rosanna brings more than 30 years of management experience to her roles at Naples Art Institute. As Office Manager, she manages the everyday operations Naples Art Institute and oversees the reception desk and guest relations as well as billing and human resources administration. As Executive Administrative Assistant, Rosanna supports the Executive Director/Chief Curator. Originally from Italy, Rosanna enjoys working at Naples Art Institute, not only because of her personal love of the visual arts, but also because she gets to meet people from many different backgrounds.
rosanna.coscia@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 109
Mary Visgilio
Special Projects Coordinator
Mary’s main focus is on recruitment and placement of volunteers for special projects. With a degree and background in Special Education, Mary transitioned to sales where she spent the majority of her career before moving to Naples from the Northeast in 2012.
Mary loves meeting new people, discovering their talents and how they can play a role in the growth of Naples Art Institute. Until she was introduced to Naples Art Institute, she never knew the extent of her love for the arts and how valuable its contribution to the community truly is.  She considers Naples Art Institute her true happy place.
mary.visgilio@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Myra Jaimes
Strategic Program Development
myra.jaimes@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 108
Bianca Bellido
Marketing & Communications Coordinator
Bianca is a marketing and communications professional with eight years of experience spanning nonprofits, education, architecture, and real estate. She holds a BA in Communications and specializes in graphic design, photography, and project management. With a background in agency account management, she brings a collaborative approach to creating effective, results-driven marketing strategies.
bianca.bellido@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Ext. 107
Nabil Benjelloun
Guest Relations Associate
Nabil engages regularly with visitors at Naples Art Institute. Having performed in theatre for most of his life, Nabil has taken part in multiple shows in Naples and Southwest Florida.  While much of his training has been in theatre, his primary focus is film and television, and he recently starred in commercials for businesses in Fort Myers.
A lifetime love of the humanities drew Nabil to Naples Art Institute, as well as a desire to become more involved with local artists and organizations.
guestrelations@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Nancy Reilly
Guest Relations Associate
Nancy joined Naples Art Institute after a 30+ year career in design and sales. She has received a degree in Industrial Design complemented by an MBA. Her customer-first focus, coupled with her business development expertise, led to leadership roles in sales and marketing, building brands and managing multi-million-dollar revenue streams.
Nancy also recognizes the importance of giving back to the Naples community and volunteers with numerous organizations of interest. As a life-long advocate of the arts, she enthusiastically champions Naples Art Institute’s leadership position as a hub of visual contemporary art.
guestrelations@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Michaelene Romano
Guest Relations Associate
With a diverse background in the Arts, Myki boasts a distinguished career in both Commercial and Residential Interior Design, along with her notable role as an Internet content producer, collaborating with students at the Broadcast School in Chicago. Her academic pursuits led her to study Art Illustration at the renowned Art Institute of Chicago, and Creative Writing at Loyola University, fueling her ambition to finalize the children's picture books she has authored. Myki's formative experience in sales at Disney's golden books division served as a pivotal introduction to her enduring passion for artistic expression.
In addition to her professional accomplishments, Myki has devoted her time to empowering students on the Autism Spectrum, assisting them in educational settings, and guiding their career placements. Through her involvement in various nonprofit organizations, she has developed a profound understanding of the immeasurable value art holds for both individuals and their communities. Contributing to the ongoing success of the Napes Art Institute comes naturally to Myki, as she recognizes the profound impact of art and shares an unwavering dedication to those who dabble in artistic endeavors, as well as those who cherish and support the love of art.
guestrelations@naplesart.org
|
239.262.6517
Daniel Broderick
Maintenance

Join Our Inner Circle!
Become a member of Naples Art Institute
Enjoy a variety of benefits including discounts on exhibitions and purchases at the Naples Art Shop, exclusive access to docent-led exhibition tours,
NARM membership,
invitations to members-only parties and other engaging programming throughout the year. Your membership not only admits you to the Naples Art Institute’s ‘inner circle’, it helps keep our organization vibrant! Explore our membership levels below and join today.
Membership Levels
Student | $25
Must be currently attending school & show I.D.
E-Newsletter and notifications of programs & events
Invitations to members-only parties
Exclusive access to ticketed, docent-led exhibition tours
10% discount at Naples Art Shop
Discounted admission to exhibitions
Access to the Naples Art Institute’s library/archives

Individual | $100
E-Newsletter and notifications of programs and events
Invitations to members-only parties
Exclusive access to ticketed, docent-led exhibition tours
10% discount at Naples Art Shop
Discounted admission to exhibitions
Access to the Naples Art Institute’s library/archives
JOIN TODAY
Family | $150
E-Newsletter and notifications of programs and events
Invitations to members-only parties
Exclusive access to ticketed, docent-led exhibition tours
10% discount at Naples Art Shop
Discounted admission to exhibitions
Access to the Naples Art Institute’s library/archives
Discounts on adult workshops/classes
Reciprocal membership at 1,100 participating museums (
NARM

Discounted exhibition tickets for guests

E-Newsletter and notifications of programs and events

Corporate Business | $2500
Naples Art Institute e-newsletter and notifications of programs and events
Invitations to members-only parties
10% discount at Naples Art Institute Shop
Reciprocal membership at 1,100 participating museums (NARM)
Free admission to special exhibitions for members and up to 2 accompanying guests
Discounted exhibition tickets for accompanying guests
20 free (personalized) single-admission tickets to special exhibitions for distribution to clients or  staff
Ability to host a private event at Naples Art Institute (up to 3 hr. space rental only, subject to availability, restrictions apply)

Corporate Collector Member | $5000
Naples Art Institute e-newsletter and notifications of programs and events
Invitations to members-only parties
10% discount at Naples Art Institute Shop
Reciprocal membership at 1,100 participating museums (NARM)
Free admission to special exhibitions for members and up to 2 accompanying guests
Discounted exhibition tickets for accompanying guests
20 free (personalized) single-admission tickets to special exhibitions for distribution to clients or  staff
Ability to host a private event at Naples Art Institute (up to 3 hr. space rental only, subject to availability, restrictions apply)
Ability to display select artworks from Naples Art Institute’s permanent collection in the corporate office (for up to 1 yr., terms and restrictions apply)
Full-day team-building art workshop and event for up to 12 people

Support The Arts
Join us in our mission to inspire curiosity, forge meaningful connections, and promote learning and growth within our community. Your generous donation will directly fund crucial initiatives at Naples Art Institute, empowering us to continue making a profound impact through our transformative programs and activities. Your support is vital to our success and the enrichment of our community.
Below are some examples of what your donations can support.
